title_et: PÖFFi filmitööstusüritus toimub tänavu virtuaalselt
title_en: Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event happens fully online this year
title_ru: Кинорынок Таллиннского кинофестиваля «Тёмные ночи» пройдет онлайн
lead_et: Pimedate Ööde filmifestivali rahvusvaheline filmivaldkonna professionaalidele suunatud suursündmus Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event kolib selleks sügiseks veebi.
lead_ru: В этом году спутник Таллиннского кинофестиваля «Тёмные ночи» – кинорынок Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event – пройдет полностью онлайн. Это обусловлено потенциальными ограничениями на путешествия из-за COVID-19.
lead_en: Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event, the industry strand of the Tallinn Black Nights Film Festival has decided to move online completely due to likely travel restrictions caused by the resurgence of COVID-19.
contents_et:
Põhjuseks on tõenäoliselt ka sügisel kehtivad reisimisega seotud piirangud, mis ei luba suurel osal külalistest Tallinna tulla või seovad siia saabumise liikumisvabaduse kärpimisega.

„Teeme seda raske südamega, aga me ei taha võtta riske,” ütles ürituse juht Marge Liiske. Vastava otsuseni jõuti pärast konsulteerimist terviseametnikega, kelle prognoos ei ennusta sügiseks viiruse vaibumist.

Veebi kolimine annab Liiske sõnul samas võimaluse üritust laiendada ja avab ukse neile, kes ei saaks muidu ajapuudusel või kauguse tõttu Tallinna tulla. Ühtlasi on see hea võimalus katsetada uuenduslikke digitaalseid lahendusi.

Endiselt jätkub valmivate või kavandatavate filmiprojektide vastuvõtt Baltic Evendi kaastootmisturule, filmi- ja telesarjade stsenaariumite võistlusele Script Pool ning Põhja- ja Baltimaade stsenaristide projektitutvustuste foorumile POWR Baltic Stories Exchange. Vastuvõtt lõpeb 21. septembril.

Ürituse delegaatidele ja akrediteeritud välispressile garanteeritakse ligipääs üritustele ja Pimedate Ööde filmifestivali kavas olevatele filmidele.

Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Evendi programmi kuuluvad veel seminarid, õpikojad, meistriklassid ja vestlusringid, mis käsitlevad filmitööstuse ja teleturu aktuaalseid teemasid. Samuti leiab esimest korda aset PÖFFi Akadeemia, kus saavad end täiendada filmindusega seotud erialade esindajad alates näitlejatest ja lõpetades heliloojatega.

Programmi esimesed üritused ja esinejad avalikustab Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event septembris.

Pimedate Ööde filmifestival leiab tänavu aset 13.–29. novembrini. Koroonaviiruse levikust tulenevalt on ette valmistamisel mitu võimalikku stsenaariumit, sealhulgas toimumist hübriidfestivalina või halvimal juhul tervenisti virtuaalsel kujul.
contents_en:
Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event, the industry strand of the Tallinn Black Nights Film Festival has decided to move online completely due to likely travel restrictions caused by the resurgence of COVID-19.

The preparations for the 24th edition of the Tallinn Black Nights Film Festival include the readiness to provide global industry and press access for the films and events, while preparations for holding a physical event are still underway.
 
Following the first signs of the possible resurgence of COVID-19 in the country, the organisers of the festival and its affiliated industry event have followed the predictions of the Health Board of Estonia and made the decision to move the industry programs online, while continuing to accept project submissions. The global film industry representatives will still be able to apply for access to all events, project pitches and films regardless of their geographical location.

Marge Liiske, Head of Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event commented: „Following the discussions with Estonia’s health officials, it seems more than likely that there will be another outbreak in one form or another and that foreign travel will either be blocked or with restrictions. This would not enable for our guests to attend the events properly and thus, with a heavy heart, we have decided from early on to not to take any risks and move all our activities online this year.”

“Having said that, I believe that moving online also presents us with some new opportunities and also for the audience – we hope that even more film industry professionals than before are able to benefit from our program, as they do not have to travel to Tallinn to attend the events and they can access the content from anywhere at their best convenience. Also, while preparing the programme we can play around with different engaging digital formats and involve speakers, who would not be able to visit us in Tallinn,” Liiske added.

The team is currently busy working on the programme and the first speakers will be announced in September. The programme will include seminars, workshops, masterclasses, panel discussions, as usual, covering the most burning topics of film and TV market as well as PÖFF Academy events directed towards actors, scouting agents, film music composers, costume designers and set photographers. 

Currently, submissions are open for Baltic Event Co-production Market (projects seeking co-producers, financiers and sales agents), Script Pool Tallinn (film and series scripts worldwide competition) and POWR Baltic Stories Exchange (Nordic and Baltic scriptwriters seeking producers). The deadline for submitting the projects is September, 21 and the evaluation of the projects is carried out online. Everyone who has submitted the project has access to Industry @Tallinn & Baltic event online-program including workshops, masterclasses, panel discussions, meetings with industry professionals, etc. 
 
The programme will be announced in various stages throughout September and October.

Black Nights Film Festival is making preparations for several scenarios.
 
Since the first COVID-19-related lockdown in spring, Black Nights has been preparing for several possible scenarios, getting ready to take place physically while also upgrading the digital infrastructure that would enable to organise a hybrid or even a completely digital event. It looks likely that foreign travel to Estonia will be restricted, thus accredited foreign press and industry delegates will be granted access to the festival’s programme digitally via the Shift72 platform, no matter their geographic location. Travel of foreign filmmakers and the press will be decided upon according to the situation in October and November, depending on whether Estonia’s COVID restrictions allow movement from the country of their current residency or not.

The physical screenings, however, have not been cancelled, as the Health Board of Estonia currently remains optimistic that the complete lockdown of cinemas can be avoided this time around. As the festival has always hosted several hundred filmmakers to present their films every year, some might be forced to do so virtually this year. For this reason, the festival is preparing virtual video greeting and Q&A formats that would precede the film screenings. There is also a high probability that the festival will cut back on the size of its programme this year.

Tiina Lokk, the director and head of the programme of Black Nights commented: “Our off-season side events, the Haapsalu Horror Film Festival we organised completely online during the lockdown this spring, and the Tartu Love Film Festival which is currently taking place as a hybrid event, have provided us with the valuable experience of organising virtual screenings and Q&As and combining them with a physical event. We are doing everything in our power to hold physical screenings and bring over as many foreign guests as possible, but the virus and Estonia’s Health Board will have the final say in these matters.” 

The festival’s plans for digital development goes further than this though, including plans to build, over the course of the next couple of years, a unique online environment that caters the festival’s needs in terms of organising public and closed screenings, conferences and an extensive online industry platform that includes a market place, virtual meeting and pitching rooms and a year-around project market to connect projects at all stages of their cycle with respective parties of interest – financiers, producers, distributors etc.
 
Another important aspect will be the year-around promotion of Estonia as a location for production and recruiting talent, including the introduction of locations of interest, a database of the country’s professionals, exhibiting the services they provide and the content they have produced. Estonia’s first two regional film funds – the Viru Film Fund and the Tartu Film Fund – will be in charge of keeping the locations and talent pools up to date.
 
The third fundamental element of the new platform is education, that will see the launch of PÖFF Academy aiming to provide high-quality audiovisual education with partners at the Estonian Film Institute, the Baltic Film, Media, Art and Communication School and the Pallas University of Applied Sciences. This will be based on the structure that has been laid out by the Creative Gate project, organised by the Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event team, that has been holding events directed towards actors, scouting agents, film music composers, costume designers and set photographers over the last three years, and which added the European Film Academy Masterclasses into the mix last year.
 
Festival director Tiina Lokk commented:  „Some of the changes that are being prepared will actually rewire the festival’s DNA, making it more digital, networked, ubiquitous and inclusive than ever before! But first and foremost, we are hoping to make the physical festival still happen this year!” she added.

The 24th Tallinn Black Nights Film Festival will run from the 13th until the 29th of November.
Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event will run from the 23rd until the 27th of November.
contents_ru:
После появления первых признаков возможной второй волны COVID-19 в стране организаторы учли прогнозы Департамента здоровья Эстонии и приняли решение перевести программу кинорынка в онлайн-режим, продолжив принимать проектные заявки. Представители мировой киноиндустрии по-прежнему смогут подавать заявки на получение доступа ко всем мероприятиям, презентациям проектов и фильмам независимо от их географического положения.

«По итогам консультаций с представителями здравоохранения Эстонии представляется более чем вероятным, что в той или иной форме произойдет еще одна вспышка заболеваемости и что будет наложен запрет на зарубежные поездки либо введены ограничения. Это не позволило бы нашим гостям должным образом посещать мероприятия, и поэтому с тяжелым сердцем мы заблаговременно решили не рисковать и перенести в этом году все наши мероприятия в виртуальную среду», - прокомментировала директор Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event Марге Лийске.

«Я считаю, что переезд в Интернет также создаст для нас и для аудитории некоторые новые возможности: мы надеемся, что из нашей программы смогут извлечь пользу даже больше профессионалов киноиндустрии, чем раньше, поскольку им не нужно будет ехать в Таллинн и они смогут получить доступ к контенту из любой удобной для них географической точки. Кроме того, при подготовке программы мы можем поиграть с различными привлекательными цифровыми форматами и привлечь докладчиков, которые не смогли бы посетить нас в Таллинне», - добавила Лийске.

В настоящее время команда работает над программой, и первые докладчики будут объявлены в сентябре. Программа включит в себя, как обычно, семинары, мастерские, мастер-классы, панельные дискуссии, которые покроют все самые животрепещущие темы, а также пройдут мероприятия Академии PÖFF, ориентированные на актеров, агентов, кинокомпозиторов, художников по костюмам и фотографов-декораторов. 

В настоящее время открыт прием заявок на участие в Baltic Event Co-production Market (проекты для сопродюсеров, инвесторов и торговых агентов), Script Pool Tallinn (всемирный конкурс сценариев фильмов и сериалов) и POWR Baltic Stories Exchange (для сценаристов из стран Северной Европы и Балтии, ищущих продюсеров). Срок подачи проектов – 21 сентября, и их оценивание проводится онлайн. Каждый участник, приславший проект, будет иметь доступ к онлайн-программе мероприятий Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event, включающей семинары, мастер-классы, панельные дискуссии, встречи с профессионалами киноиндустрии и т. д. 

В этом году впервые будет организована Академия PÖFF, целью которой является предоставление высококачественного аудиовизуального образования.

Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event пройдет с 23 по 27 ноября 2020, и его программа будет объявлена поэтапно в течение сентября и октября.

Таллиннский кинофестиваль «Тёмные ночи» пройдет в этом году с 13 по 29 ноября. Из-за распространения коронавируса организаторы готовятся к нескольким возможным сценариям, включая традиционную организацию на месте и готовность в случае необходимости провести мероприятия самого фестиваля частично или полностью онлайн.

Аккредитованные иностранные представители прессы и профессионалы киноиндустрии получат доступ к программе фестиваля в цифровом виде на платформе Shift72, независимо от их географического положения.

title_et: Pressi turvajuhised
title_en: Safety requirements
title_ru: Меры безопасности и стратегия пресс-службы кинофестиваля «Тёмные ночи» (PÖFF) в свете COVID-19
contents_et:
**PÖFFi pressiosakonna meetmed koroonaviiruse ennetamiseks**

PÖFF 24 on hetkeseisuga plaanis korraldada neli pressikonverentsi, mille asukohad on veel selgitamisel. Neist kolme saab jälgida ka video vahendusel. Avapressikonverents toimub 6. novembril ning viimane, auhindade pressikonverents (veebiülekannet ei toimu) leiab aset 28. novembril. Kaks ülejäänud üritust on PÖFFi elutööpreemia laureaatide pressikonverentsid, mis toimuvad juhul, kui auhinnasaajad saavad tulla Eestisse. Vastasel juhul toimuvad need üritused muus formaadis. Nende ürituste kuupäevad selguvad novembri alguses. 
 
Festival järgib pressiüritustel 2+2 reeglit ja teeb maskikandmise kohustuslikuks, varustades osalejaid maskide ja kohti desovahenditega. Ka esinejad kannavad maske ja on publikust eraldatud minimaalselt kolmemeetrise vahega. Avapressikonverentsi ühe osana kutsuvad festivali esindajad inimesi üles kinodes ja festivaliüritustel maske kandma.

Festival jätab sel aastal ära tavapärased kinosaali pressiseansid ning ei ava ajakirjanikele ka füüsilist kogunemiskohta ehk pressikeskust.

**Pimedate Ööde filmifestivali välisajakirjanike vastuvõtuga seotud reeglid:**
1.	Kõik välisriikidest saabujad peavad kuni 72 tundi enne asu- või kodukohariigist lahkumist tegema PCR-meetodil koroonaviiruse testi. Negatiivse tulemuse tõestamiseks peavad nad edastama enne väljalendu PÖFFi külaliste osakonnale ingliskeelse sertifikaadi.
2.	Kolmandatest riikidest saabunud väliskülaline täidab PPA eritaotluse vormi ning edastab selle PÖFFi külaliste osakonnale.
Välisministeeriumi kodulehelt leiate [Eestisse reisimist puudutava info](https://vm.ee/en/information-countries-and-self-isolation-requirements-passengers) ja [viisainfo](https://vm.ee/en/taxonomy/term/41). Tingimused võivad muutuda vastavalt Eestis riiklikult kehtestatud piirangutele (Välisministeerium, Terviseamet).
3.	Enne Eesti Vabariiki saabumist täidab festivali väliskülaline ankeedi „Data for Coronavirus test“, mille külaliste osakond on talle eelnevalt saatnud. Ankeedis olevad andmed on vajalikud Medicumis tehtavaks koroonatestiks.
4.	Pärast külalise saabumist Eesti Vabariiki korraldab PÖFF tema vastuvõtmise, transpordi ja koroonatesti tegemise Medicumis.
5.	Koroonatesti tegemiseks peab kõigil väliskülalistel olema kaasas isikut tõendav dokument.
6.	PÖFF korraldab külalise transpordi Medicumist hotelli, kus ta püsib eneseisolatsioonis kuni testi vastuse saamiseni (maksimaalselt 24 tundi) SYNLABi laborist. Vastus edastatakse telefoni teel.
7.	Negatiivse tulemuse korral saab külaline liikuda siseruumides maski kandes (maskid festivali poolt) ning järgides kõiki ohutusnõudeid (käte desinfitseerimine, 2+2 reegel, ainult festivali territooriumil liikumine). Kui jäädakse kauemaks, tuleb seitsmendal päeval teha kordustest.
8.	Iga filmi delegatsioonile või väliskülalisele on festival määranud vabatahtliku kontaktisiku, kes jälgib, et külaline järgiks ohutusnõudeid.
9.	Väliskülalisi juhendatakse mitte lahkuma festivali territooriumilt, kohtumised määratakse ainult hotelli fuajeesse, kus kolmandate isikutega suhtlemisel tuleb kasutada kõiki ettevaatusabinõusid (käte desinfitseerimine, maski kandmine, 2+2 reegel). Vajadusel tuleb külaliste osakonnale edastada kolmanda isiku kontakt.

**PÖFFi ajal:**
Festivali territooriumil mõõdetakse pisteliselt kehatemperatuuri.
Kõik festivalile akrediteeritud külalised peavad järgima korraldajate ettekirjutusi:
1.	Mistahes piirangud on kooskõlas Eestis riiklikult kehtestatud piirangute ja soovitustega. Nende muutumisel teeb korraldaja vajadusel muudatusi ka ürituse piirangutes.
2.	Käte regulaarne desinfitseerimine.
3.	Maski õigesti kandmine.
4.	Sotsiaalse distantsi hoidmine (2+2 reegel).
5.	HOIA.me äpi kasutamise soovitus kõigile üritusel osalejatele ja viibijatele.

**Tegutsemise juhis, kui koroonaviiruse test osutub positiivseks:**
1.	Kui testi tulemus osutub positiivseks, jääb külaline oma hotellituppa eneseisolatsiooni, kuni perearstikeskus Sinu Arst, kes külalist jälgib, annab loa tagasisõiduks. Vajadusel külaline hospitaliseeritakse.
2.	Kõik tervishoiuteenuse kulud, hotelli lisaööd ja teised kuluartiklid, mis on seotud haigestumise või koroonaviirusega, kannab külaline ise ehk tema tervisekindlustus.
3.	Festivali väliskülalisel tuleb reisikindlustuse tegemisel arvestada võimalusega, et ta tasub ise kõigi raviteenuste eest. Kaetud peavad olema võimaliku karantiiniolukorraga seotud kulud (keskmiselt 14-päevane lisaviibimine Eestis), vajadusel ka meditsiiniline evakuatsioon koduriiki või haiglaravi.
4.	Koroonaviiruses inimene ei tohi Eestist lahkuda enne, kui ta on arsti poolt terveks tunnistatud. 

**Väliskülalise kodumaale naasmine:**
Külaline peab tutvuma oma riigi välisministeeriumi kodulehel olevate koroonaviiruse tingimuste ja kohustustega, mis kaasnevad Eesti Vabariigist kodumaale naasmisel.
contents_en:
The Black Nights Film Festival (PÖFF) corona virus requirements for foreign guests:
 
1. All the guests arriving from abroad must do a corona virus PCR test up to 72 hours before their departure from their country of location or residence and hold a certificate in English to prove a negative result. The certificate has to be forwarded to the Guest Department of PÖFF before the flight.

2. Foreign guests who have arrived from a third country shall complete the Police and Border Guard Board’s special application form and forward that to the Guest Department of PÖFF.
Information concerning travelling to Estonia is available on the [homepage of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs](https://vm.ee/en/information-countries-and-self-isolation-requirements-passengers). Visa information is available [here](https://vm.ee/en/taxonomy/term/41). 
The requirements may change in accordance with the national restrictions established in Estonia – the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Health Board.

3. Before arriving in the Republic of Estonia, foreign guests of the festival will complete the ‘Data for Coronavirus Test’ form which the Guest Department has previously sent to them. The data included in the form are necessary for corona virus testing at Medicum.

4. PÖFF will organise the reception, transfer and nasopharyngeal corona virus testing at Medicum.

5. All the foreign guests must carry a personal identification document for corona testing.

6. PÖFF will organise the transfer from Medicum to the hotel where the guest will wait in self-isolation until SYNLAB’s laboratory phones with the result (max 24 h). 

7. In the case of a negative result, guests can move about indoors wearing a mask (masks are provided by the festival) and adhering to all the safety requirements (disinfecting hands, keeping the 2 + 2 distance, staying only in the festival territory). If the stay is longer, a repeat test has to be taken on the 7th day.

8. For the delegation or foreign guest of every film, the festival has appointed a volunteer contact person who checks that the guest complies with safety requirements.

9. Foreign guests are instructed not to leave the festival territory and meetings are to be held in the hotel lobby where all the safety precautions must be taken when communicating with third persons (disinfecting hands, wearing a mask, keeping the 2 + 2 distance), and, if necessary, the contact details of the third persons will be forwarded to the Guest Department.
 
**Safety during PÖFF**
Random body temperature checks will be performed in the festival territory.
All the accredited guests of the festival must comply with the orders of the organisers:
1. All the restrictions are in accordance with the nationally established restrictions and recommendations in Estonia. Upon changes therein, the organiser will, if necessary, also make changes in the festival restrictions.
2.  Wearing masks at all public festival venues, incl. cinemas.
3. Regular hand disinfecting.
4. Recommendations and information on wearing the mask correctly and the distribution of masks.
5. Keeping social distance (2+2). 
6. Recommendation to all the festival participants and guests to use the HOIA.me application.

**Instructions on how to act in the case of a positive corona virus test:**

1. If the test result is positive, the guest will stay in self-isolation in his/her hotel room under the observation of a physician from the family physician centre Sinu Arst, until the physician grants him/her the permission to return home. The guest will be hospitalised, if necessary.
2. All the healthcare service costs, additional nights at the hotel and other expenses related to illness and corona virus will be covered by the guest (i.e. his/her health insurance).
3. Upon concluding a travel insurance contract, foreign guests of the festival have to include payment for all the healthcare services so that it also covers the possible quarantine costs (the average of a 14-day additional stay in Estonia), the medical evacuation of a corona virus patient to the home country, if necessary, and – in the worst case – the high costs of hospital treatment.

**Guests have to review the corona virus related requirements and obligations entailed in returning from the Republic of Estonia on the homepage of the foreign ministry of their home country.**
contents_ru:
**Меры безопасности пресс-центра PÖFF в свете COVID-19**

На данный момент на 24-м кинофестивале «Тёмные ночи» (PÖFF) запланировано провести четыре пресс-конференции, место проведения которых пока уточняется. С трех из них будет организована трансляция. Первая пресс-конференция, посвященная открытию кинофестиваля, состоится 6 ноября, а последняя пройдет 28 ноября и будет посвящена награждению (ее не будут транслировать в веб-сети). Остальные же две пресс-конференции будут посвящены лауреатам учрежденной кинофестивалем PÖFF премии за вклад в кинематограф, они состоятся в случае, если лауреаты приедут в Эстонию. В противном случае эти мероприятия будут проведены в другом формате. Даты проведения пресс-конференций будут сообщены в начале ноября. 

На пресс-конференции будет действовать правило «2+2», ношение масок обязательно, масками и антисептиками гостей и участников снабдят организаторы кинофестиваля. Гости, выступающие перед зрителями, обязаны носить маску и находиться на расстоянии как минимум 3 метра. На первой пресс-конференции организаторы кинофестиваля обратятся к кинозрителям с просьбой носить маски в кинотеатрах и на фестивальных мероприятиях.

В этом году на фестивале отменяются пресс-показы и физический пресс-центр (место сбора журналистов).

1.	Все гости кинофестиваля, приезжающие из других стран, обязаны пройти тест на коронавирус по методу  PCR  за 72 часа до отъезда с места проживания, чтобы получить сертификат на английском языке, подтверждающий негативный ответ, и отправить его в пресс-центр фестиваля, занимающийся приемом иностранных гостей кинофестиваля.
2.	Гость кинофестиваля, прибывший из страны третьего мира, обязан заполнить формуляр PPA и представить его в штаб кинофестиваля. Информацию, касающуюся поездки в Эстонию, можно найти на сайте МИД Эстонии: https://vm.ee/en/information-countries-and-self-isolation-requirements-passengers  Информация о визах: https://vm.ee/en/taxonomy/term/41 
3.	Условия могут измениться в соответствии с ограничениями, установленными МИДом Эстонии и Департаментом здоровья.
4.	Перед приездом в Эстонскую Республику иностранный гость кинофестиваля обязан заполнить анкету Data for Coronavirus test, которую ему заранее отправили из штаба кинофестиваля, занимающегося иностранными гостями. Данные заполненной анкеты необходимы для сдачи теста на коронавирус.
5.	Кинофестиваль «Тёмные ночи» (PÖFF) организует прием и трансфер иностранных гостей, приехавших в Эстонию, а также прохождение теста на коронавирус в центре здоровья Medicum. 
6.	Для прохождения теста на коронавирус у всех иностранных гостей должно быть с собой удостоверение личности. 
7.	Кинофестиваль PÖFF организует трансфер иностранных гостей из центра здоровья Medicum в отель, где они обязаны находиться на самоизоляции до поступления ответа по телефону из лаборатории SYNLAB (максимум 24 часа). 
8.	В случае негативного теста иностранный гость должен находиться в помещениях в маске (масками участников обеспечивает кинофестиваль) и соблюдать все меры безопасности (дезинфицировать руки, соблюдать дистанцию «2+2», не выходить за территорию кинофестиваля). Если иностранный гость задержится после кинофестиваля, то он должен будет на 7-й день нахождения в Эстонии сделать повторный тест.
9.	К каждой делегации фестивального фильма или отдельному иностранному гостю организаторы кинофестиваля прикрепляют волонтера, который будет следить за выполнением гостями мер предосторожности.
10.	Иностранные гости не должны покидать территорию кинофестиваля, все встречи будут проходить в фойе отеля, где при общении с третьими лицами необходимо соблюдать все меры предосторожности (дезинфицировать руки, носить маску, соблюдать правило «2+2»), а также при необходимости предоставить в штаб кинофестиваля контактные данные третьего лица.
 
**Во время кинофестиваля «Тёмные ночи» (PÖFF)**

На территории кинофестиваля среди участников будет проводиться выборочный замер температуры тела. 
Все аккредитованные гости обязаны выполнять распоряжения организаторов кинофестиваля: 
1.	Все ограничения согласованы с установленными в Эстонии на государственном уровне ограничениями и пожеланиями. В случае изменений организаторы кинофестиваля немедленно последуют им и информируют участников. 
2.	Регулярное мытье и дезинфекция рук. 
3.	Правильное ношение маски и информация о раздаче масок. 
4.	Соблюдение социальной дистанции («2+2»). 
5.	Желательное пользование приложением HOIA.me на всех мероприятиях для участников и присутствующих.

**Руководство действий в случае позитивного теста:** 

1.	Если результат теста оказался позитивным, гость кинофестиваля обязан самоизолироваться в номере отеля, где он будет находиться под наблюдением врача из центра семейных врачей Sinu Arst («Твой врач»), пока лечащий врач не даст разрешение на отъезд домой. В случае необходимости иностранного гостя госпитализируют. 
2.	Все расходы за медицинские услуги, дополнительное проживание в отеле и прочие расходы, связанные с заболеванием, несет сам заразившийся коронавирусом (то есть покрывает его медицинская страховка). 
3.	Заключая договор о страховании путешествия, гость кинофестиваля должен учитывать расходы на медицинские услуги, а также гарантировать покрытие расходов во время нахождения в условиях карантина (14-дневное пребывание в Эстонии), при необходимости надо учесть возможность эвакуации больного коронавирусом на родину или в худшем случае высокие затраты за стационарное лечение. Пожалуйста, обратите внимание, что Европейской карточки медицинского страхования может быть недостаточно.

**Возвращение иностранного гостя кинофестиваля на родину:**

Иностранный гость обязан ознакомиться на сайте МИДа своего государства с условиями, связанными с распространением коронавируса, и обязательными действиями после возвращения на родину из Эстонской Республики.

title_et: Vaata PÖFFi avapressikonverentsi salvestust
lead_et: Pimedate Ööde filmifestivali 6. novembril toimunud avapressikonverentsil anti ülevaade tänavu erakordsetes tingimustes loodud festivali korraldusest. Samuti tutvustati nii [PÖFFi](https://poff.ee/programmid/) kui ka [Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event](https://industry.poff.ee) programmi.
contents_et:
#### **Pressikonverentsi saab järele vaatada Elisa Stage vahendusel [SIIN](https://poff.elisastage.ee/landing/bc/mZ1D2CpUpk/iiW6SG4s8Sy).**

Pressikonverentsi juhib festivali kommunikatsioonijuht Hannes Aava.  

**Kõnelevad**

- PÖFFi direktor ja programmijuht Tiina Lokk 
- noorte- ja lastefilmide festivali Just Film juht Mikk Granström 
- lühifilmide ja animatsioonifestivali PÖFF Shorts juht Grete Nellis 
- Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event juht Marge Liiske 
- PÖFFi kõrvalfestivali KinoFF juht Jana Budkovskaja 
- SYNLAB Põhjamaade turundus- ja kommunikatsioonijuht ja avaliku testimise koordinaator Gerly Kedelauk 
- PÖFFi esitleja Elisa tegevjuht Sami Seppänen    


PÖFFi programmi saab nautida maskidega nii kinodes kui ka [veebivahendusel](https://kino.poff.ee). Festivali [avatseremoonia](https://poff.ee/artikkel/avatseremoonia/) toimub 12. novembril kinos Coca-Cola Plaza. PÖFF toob oma [põhiprogrammis](https://poff.ee/programmid/) ekraanile 172 pikka filmi 63 riigist, ühes nendega neli võistlus- ja 11 eriprogrammi 33 maailma- ja 29 rahvusvahelise esilinastusega.

title_et: PÖFFi esimeste filmide seas on ka Oscari võitja uus töö
title_en: PÖFF announces first 8 films of the Official Selection – Competition
title_ru: PÖFF объявил первые фильмы этого года
lead_et: Oscari võitja István Szabó uus film on üks kaheksast esimesest põhivõistlusprogrammi linateosest, mille Pimedate Ööde filmifestival välja kuulutab.
lead_ru: XXIV Таллиннский кинофестиваль «Тёмные ночи» (Pimedate Ööde Kinofestival, PÖFF) представил первые восемь фильмов, вошедших в основную конкурсную программу. Среди них – шесть мировых премьер и две международные, в том числе две киноработы на русском языке.
lead_en: From legendary veterans to emerging new voices – here are the first eight films of this year's Official Selection – Competition, that will be competing for the festival's main prize.
contents_et:
38 aastat tagasi „**Mefisto**” eest parima mitteingliskeelse filmi Oscari ja seitse aastat tagasi ka PÖFFi elutööauhinna võitnud Ungari vanameistri viimane film „**Lõppsõna**” (Zárójelentés) on lugu hinnatud kardioloogist, kes naaseb pärast pensionile saatmist kodukülla ja otsustab hakata seal inimesi ravima. Paraku ei sobi tema entusiasm kohalikesse oludesse, tuues kaasa tõsiseid konflikte – tulemusena rullub temast üle kontrollimatu vaimse agressiooni laine.


![Final report.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/Final_report_02a00ce38c.jpg)
*Kaader filmist „Lõppsõna”*

Filmi peaosas on legendaarne Klaus Maria Brandauer, Szabó lemmiknäitleja, kes mängis ka tema kuulsas triloogias „Mefisto”, „Ooberst Redl” ja „Hanussen” – sellest, kuidas vaim end võimust pimestada laseb. Nüüd saab see filmiajaloo suurimaid tandemeid taas üle 30 aasta kokku.

„Lõppsõna” kuulub ka Euroopa filmiakadeemia 2020. aasta parimate mängufilmide eelvalikusse. Pimedate Ööde filmifestivalil näeb seda esimest korda väljaspool Ungarit.


![Ulbolysn.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/Ulbolysn_ce0412a8f5.jpg)
*Kaader filmist „Ulbolsõn – üksi kõigi vastu”*

Kasahstani režissööri Ädilhan Jeržanovi filmis „**Ulbolsõn – üksi kõigi vastu**” (Ұлболсын) röövib kohaliku auuli mõjuvõimas posija Ulbolsõni õe, et teha temast oma noorem naine. Ulbolsõn otsustab õe iga hinna eest päästa, heites kinda auuli patriarhaalsele mõtteviisile ja kommetele. Jeržanov on üks kasahhi juhtivaid filmilavastajaid, kelle töid on näidatud paljudel nimekatel festivalidel, sh Cannes´is, Veneetsias ja Torontos. Tema varasem looming – „Maailma õrn ükskõiksus” ja „Omanikud” – peaks olema tuttav ka PÖFFi vaatajatele. Jeržanovi kõige uuemat filmi näeb Eestis esimest korda maailmas.

Samuti esimest korda maailmas linastab PÖFFil oma filmi venelane Aleksandr Mindadze, keda paljud teavad ehk enam hoopis hinnatud stsenaristina, paljude Vadim Abdrašitovi filmide, sh „Plumbum ehk Ohtlik mäng”, „Teener” ja „Tantsija aeg” järgi. „**Parketil**” (Паркет) on tema neljas töö režissöörina, eelmise filmi „Armas Hans, kallis Pjotr” tunnistasid aasta parimaks Vene linateoseks nii sealne filmiakadeemia Nika kui ka filmiuurijate ja -kriitikute gild. Mindadze uus film on lugu kolmest tantsijast, tango à trois leiutajast, kes tulevad 25 aastat pärast lahkuminekut uuesti kokku, et esineda tähtpäevakontserdil. Vanad tunded löövad lõkkele, nagu poleks möödunudki veerand sajandit. Üllatuslikus kõrvalosas teeb kaasa ka Taavi Eelmaa.

![Parquet.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/Parquet_85829368b4.jpg)

*Kaader filmist „Parket”*

Teinegi põhivõistlusprogrammi film on pärit Venemaalt – oma uut tööd esitleb Anna Melikjan. „**Kolmekesi**” (Трое) on melodraama mehest ja naisest – abielupaarist – ja veel ühest naisest, kes nende ellu tuleb. Klassikalise armastuskolmnurga peaosas on Vene filmi superstaar Konstantin Habenski. Melikjani tuntuim film on seni „Näkineid”, mis võitis 2008. aastal Sundance´i filmifestivalil parima välisfilmi režii ja Berliini filmifestivalil rahvusvahelise filmiajakirjanike ühingu auhinna. Samuti esindas see Venemaad Oscari konkurentsis. „Kolmekesi” esilinastus äsja Sotšis toimunud Vene filmide festivalil Kinotavr ja võitis seal parima operaatoritöö preemia. PÖFFil näeb seda esimest korda väljaspool Venemaad.

![The Three.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/The_Three_30ca7b0cd6.jpg)
*Kaader filmist „Kolmekesi”*

Ka Eesti filmisõprade seas hästi tuntud lätlanna Laila Pakalnina toob PÖFFile oma tuliuue filmi „**Peegelpildis**” (Spogulī), mis on teravmeelne tõlgendus igihaljast Lumivalgukese loost. Kõik selle filmi tegelased tegelevad moodsalt väljendudes eneserepresentatsiooniga, nende obsessiooniks on see, kuidas nad välja näevad. Filmi visuaalne stiil on väga eriline – kaadris askeldavad inimesed teeksid justkui igast hetkest oma elus selfit.

![In the Mirror.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/In_the_Mirror_e6b446130e.jpg)
*Kaader filmist „Peegelpildis”*

Horvaatia filmikunsti esindab Dalibor Matanići „**Koidik**” (Zora) – müstiline draama, milles poja kaotusest traumeeritud perekond kistakse unenäoliste, ärevate sündmuste keerisesse. Ka seda filmi näeb maailmas esimest korda. Autori mõne aasta tagune töö „Päike on kõrgel” võitis Cannes´i festivalil kõrvalprogrammi „Un Certain Regard” auhinna ja Horvaatia esitas selle Oscarile.

![The Dawn.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/The_Dawn_8abd008529.jpg)
*Kaader filmist „Koidik”*

Noore türklanna Nisan Daği film „**Veel üks hingetõmme**” (Bir nefes daha) viib Istanbuli äärelinna, sealsete noorte pulbitsevasse maailma, mida valitseb mõistagi räppmuusika. 19-aastane narkarist räppar Fehmi armub 25-aastasesse Devinisse, kes pärineb hoopis teisest keskkonnast. Kaks kadunud hinge inspireerivad teineteist, ent peagi kerkivad selle ebavõrdse suhte kohale varjupilved. Filmile on kirjutanud muusika Türgi tuntumaid räppareid Da Poet.

![when I'm done dying.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/when_I_m_done_dying_8fea1b1460.jpg)
*Kaader filmist „Veel üks hingetõmme”*


Maailmaesilinastus on ka Portugali režissööri Leonardo António filmil „**Sõna sõna vastu**” (Submissão), mille peategelane Lúcia läheb kohtusse õigust nõudma, kui tema enda abikaasa ta vägistab. Selleks tuleb murda ühiskonnas valitsevat meestekeskset mõtteviisi.

![Submission.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/Submission_f970078498.jpg)
*Kaader filmist „Sõna sõna vastu”*

Kogu põhivõistlusprogrammi avalikustab festival 23. oktoobril. Piletite eelismüük algab päev varem.

Pimedate Ööde filmifestival leiab tänavu aset 13.– 29. novembrini kombineeritud kujul – filme saab vaadata nii kinosaalis kui virtuaalselt.
contents_en:
The lineup will see the return of some filmmakers who are already very familiar to the festival's audience, such as the Academy-Award-winning Hungarian veteran István Szabó, who has been awarded the festival’s Lifetime Achievement Award in 2013. His film Final Report will have its international premiere at Black Nights

Six of the announced films are world premieres, as Black Nights welcomes the return of Latvian auteur Laila Pakalnina with In the Mirror; the celebrated Kazakhstan director Adilkhan Yerzhanov with Ulbolsyn; the multiple-award-winning Croatian director Dalibor Matanić with The Dawn; veteran Russian scriptwriter and director Aleksandr Mindadze with Parquet; the up and coming Turkish director Nisan Dağ presenting her second feature When I’m Done Dying and the Portuguese film and TV director Leonardo António with Submission.

The first batch is rounded off by The Three by the Sundance Best-Director-award-winning Russian director Anna Melikyan. 

The festival is moving forward with preparations for a physical event and will make everything in its power to bring the filmmakers to Tallinn to attend their screenings. As Estonia's travel restrictions are decided every month, it will become clear at the end of October who can travel to Tallinn. The virtual screenings of the films will include pre-recorded Q&A's with the filmmakers.

 
**Final Report**
![Final report.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/Final_report_02a00ce38c.jpg)
Hungarian director István Szabó returns to Black Nights after accepting the Lifetime Achievement Award in 2013 with the international premiere of Final Report, a tale of a cardiology professor who returns to his home village after retirement to become the local GP. In the village, he has to navigate a complex web of unresolved conflicts, the attitude of servitude and witnesses how rumours and fake news can manipulate general opinion.

István  Szabó can be considered Hungary’s most celebrated film director as he’s films have been nominated four times for both the Academy Awards for four times (winning in 1981 with Mephisto) and for the Palme d’Or, winning the Jury Prize (Oberst Redl, 1985) and the Best Screenplay (Mephisto, 1981).  In addition, he’s won numerous awards at the Berlinale, the Golden Leopard of Locarno (25 Fireman's Street, 1973), the BAFTA for best foreign-language film (Oberst Redl, 1985) and his Being Julia brought a Golden Globe to Anette Benning in 2004.

**In the Mirror**
![In the Mirror.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/In_the_Mirror_e6b446130e.jpg)
A long-time regular in the programme the Black Nights, Latvian director Laila Pakalnina who’s Dawn (2016) won the Best Cinematography award in the Main Competition (former name for the Official Selection – Competition), is back with her latest film In the Mirror, a playful experiment taking on the snow-white motive. Pakalnina, known for her bold cinematic style, and her team shot the film entirely from a ‘selfie angle’, offering an off-kilter version of modern Latvia. In the story, the teenage daughter of a crossfit coach is threatened by the jealous rage of her ill-willed stepmother.

Pakalnina’s features, documentaries and short films have been screened at festivals all over the world, including the official selections of Berlinale, Cannes, Venice, Locarno and several times at Black Nights.

**Parquet**
![Parquet.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/Parquet_85829368b4.jpg)
Russian director Aleksandr Mindadze is among the most acclaimed contemporary Russian directors having won numerous awards for his directorial work and screenplays in Russia and abroad. His Innocent Saturday (2011) was nominated for Berlinale’s Golden Bear, while his third film My Good Hans received the Nika award for best film from the Russian Academy of Cinema Arts. Before moving to direct, Mindadze was writing screenplays for films directed by Vadim Abdrashitov, that were regularly included in the main competitions of festivals such as Berlin, Venice and Locarno.

The creators of the legendary tango  A Trois reunite for an encore performance 25 years after breaking up. They are honoured to perform at their dance club’s anniversary, and propel themselves with a passion back into working up their number. The threesome is determined to take on the night as if they had never aged, but their resolve is undermined when their families arrive to join the audience.

**Submission**
![Submission.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/Submission_f970078498.jpg)
Offering a tale of a fight for justice and emotional recovery, Submission depicts Lúcia, raped by her husband, fighting the Portuguese legal system, to force her husband, the son of the state's  vice attorney, into court. The casetakes place in closed session where Lúcia tries to find justice in a predominantly male world.

Submission is the third film by Portuguese film and TV director and producer Leonardo António.
 
**The Dawn**
![The Dawn.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/The_Dawn_8abd008529.jpg)
Set in the year 2021 in which the Croatian society has seen a drastic political turn, Mateji and hist wife raise their children in a rural area, where people leave in flocks to the city. As the community lives in information isolation, unease and pessimism are fast to creep in. Director Dalibor Matanić balances gracefully on the border of social drama and genre cinema as an odd stranger, also called Mateji, starts to build a house right next to the protagonist.
 
Out of the several feature films, series and shorts, Croatian director Dalibor Matanić is most likely best known to the international audience for his 2015 feature The High Sun, that won the Un Certain Regard Jury Prize, the Best Artistic Contribution prize at Cairo and screened at festivals all over the world, including at Black Nights.

**The Three**
![The Three.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/The_Three_30ca7b0cd6.jpg)
Russian director Anna Melikyan presents the existential crisis of a 40-something TV host, drawn into a love triangle after a failed suicide attempt. Offering another visual feast, director Anna Melikyan has achieved considerable international success with her previous films, especially with Mermaid (2007) won the Directing Award at Sundance FF, the FIPRESCI prize at the Berlinale and the Independent Camera at Karlovy Vary.

 
**When I’m Done Dying**
![when I'm done dying.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/when_I_m_done_dying_8fea1b1460.jpg)
Fehmi, a 19-year-old aspiring rapper from a rough neighbourhood of Istanbul, is addicted to bonzai, a cheap and deadly drug, jeopardizing his dreams of becoming a successful rapper. When Fehmi crosses paths with Devin, a 25-year-old affluent DJ, they fall hard for each other and find the inspiration they were lacking. But the flaming and troubled love of this unlikely duo soon becomes toxic. 

As her second feature film, Turkish director Nisan Dağ offers an emotional roller coaster into Istanbul youth, steeped into edgy rap composed by one of the most acclaimed beatmakers and rappers in Turkey, Da Poet.


**Ulbolsyn**
![Ulbolysn.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/Ulbolysn_ce0412a8f5.jpg)
While trying to get her sister’s documents out her rural school to move abroad and start a new life together, Ulbolsyn’s sister gets kidnapped. Following her tracks she finds herself confronted with a local community healer, backed by the support of the villagers, who have sensed an attack on their traditional, patriarchal community.

Director Adilkhan Yerzhanov’s films have been screened and have won awards in numerous top tier festivals around the world. His 2018 feature The Gentle Indifference of the World was screened at the Cannes,  Busan, Cairo and Black Nights, among others, while A Dark-Dark Man (2019) took part in the main competition programme of San Sebastian and won the Best Director award at Asia Pacific Screen Awards.
contents_ru:
«Нам особенно запомнится этот год со всеми сложностями, которые он принес. Они не могли не сказаться и на поступлении заявок на участие фильмов в фестивале: во время карантина был месяц, когда заявки вовсе перестали приходить. Тем большим было удивление, когда с середины лета один за другим начали приходить сильные авторские фильмы! В этом году у нас сложилась очень выдающаяся программа, поскольку мы получили много отличных фильмов! Было очень обидно отказывать некоторым замечательным работам, которые мы уже просто не могли вместить в программу», - прокомментировала директор фестиваля Тийна Локк.
 
![Final report.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/Final_report_02a00ce38c.jpg)
На главный приз фестиваля претендует фильм «Заключительный отчет» – новая работа именитого венгерского режиссера Иштвана Сабо, чья драма «Мефисто» была удостоена «Оскара» за лучший фильм на иностранном языке в 1981 году. Семь лет назад его заслуги в кинематографе были также отмечены премией PÖFF «За дело всей жизни». Европейская киноакадемия включила «Заключительный отчет» в предварительный отбор лучших игровых фильмов 2020 года. Зрители PÖFF станут первыми, кто увидит новый фильм за пределами Венгрии.
 
![The Three.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/The_Three_30ca7b0cd6.jpg)
Также на фестивале состоится международная премьера фильма известного российского режиссера Анны Меликян «Трое». В России эта мелодрама была впервые показана на «Кинотавре» в сентябре этого года, где картину отметили призом за операторскую работу. Это история про телеведущего (Константин Хабенский), его супругу (Виктория Исакова) и поэтессу (Юлия Пересильд). Это любовная история, в которой герой мечется между Москвой и Санкт-Петербургом и двумя женщинами. Рейтинг ожидания этого фильма, согласно интернет-сервису «КиноПоиск», составляет высокие 99%.
 
![Parquet.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/Parquet_85829368b4.jpg)
Второй русскоязычной картиной стала драма «Паркет» режиссера Александра Миндадзе. Сюжет фильма разворачивается вокруг танго-клуба, на паркете которого встречаются смертельно больной мужчина и его бывшая возлюбленная, которую он не видел целых 25 лет. Фильм получился по-настоящему интернациональным: в главных ролях играют польская актриса из оскароносного фильма «Ида» Павла Павликовского Агата Кулешова, один из самых известных польских драматических артистов Анджей Хыра и прима израильского

title_et: Henessi Schmidt ja Reimo Sagor osalevad rahvusvahelises tulevaste filmitähtede programmis
title_en: Eight young actors announced as new Black Night Stars
lead_et: Novembri lõpus toimub Tallinnas tulevaste filmitähtede rahvusvahelisele karjäärile suunatud programm Black Nights Stars, kus kaheksa Läänemere piirkonna noore näitleja seas võtab osa ka kaks eestlast – Henessi Schmidt ja Reimo Sagor.
lead_en: Black Nights Stars, the initiative of the Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event, has announced eight young actors from the Baltic Sea region to participate in the programme this November, also inviting young talents from Russia to attend for the first time within the RUSSIA IN FOCUS program.
contents_et:
[Black Nights Stars](https://industry.poff.ee/black-nights-stars/) viib Läänemeremaade kaheksa noort talenti viie päeva jooksul kokku filmitööstuse tipptegijate, casting directorite ja rahvusvaheliste talendiagentuuride esindajatega. Lisaks osalevad näitlejad töötubades ning omandavad rahvusvaheliseks karjääriks vajalikke teadmisi ja oskusi. 

Black Nights Stars on osa filmiprofessionaalidele suunatud programmist Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event. Viimase eestvedaja Marge Liiske sõnul on avaneb Black Nights Stars programmi kaudu kõigil Eesti ja lähiriikide näitlejatel võimalus jääda silma rahvusvahelistele talendiotsijatele ja casting directoritele. „Sel aastal keskendub Black Nights Stars just sellele, et kuidas edendada rahvusvahelist näitlejakarjääri online-kanalitesse kolinud maalimas. Sündmuste seas, mis  toimuvad sel aastal küll virtuaalselt, üle veebi, on mitmeid loenguid ja töötubasid, kuhu on oodatud kõik näitlejad, kel on huvi rahvusvahelise filmitööstuse vastu,“ kommenteeris Liiske. 

Eelmisel aastal toimunud Black Nights Stars kohtumise tulemusena sai alguse koostöö näitleja Ingrid Marguse ja Londoni agentuuriga Olivia Bell Management, mille tulemusena sõlmiti ka leping näitleja ja agentuuri vahel.  

Rahvusvaheline žürii valis sel aastal 40 kandidaadi seast programmis osalema kaheksa noort, nende seas ka Eesti noore näitlejanna Henessi Schmidti, kes on siinsele publikule tuntud sarjadest  Kodu keset linna“, „Elu keset linna“ ja „Kättemaksukontor“. Lisaks on ta kaasa teinud arvukates teatrilavastustes. Sel aastal mängis ta üht peaosalist mängufilmis „Talve“ . 

Lisaks Schmidtile osaleb Black Nights Stars programmis Vanemuise teatri draamanäitleja Reimo Sagor, kes on alates 2012. aastast mänginud ka PÖFFil linastunud filmides ("Nullpunkt", "Must alpinist", "Päevad, mis ajasid segadusse"). 2018. aastal tegi Sagor peaosatäitja debüüdi mängufilmis "Võta või jäta", mille eest  pälvis aasta hiljem Eesti Kultuurkapitali audiovisuaalse kunsti sihtkapitali parima meesnäitleja preemia. 

Koos Eesti näitlejatega osalevad Black Nights Stars programmis Aaron Hilmer Saksamaalt, Antoni Sałaj Poolast, Hanna Ardehn Rootsist, Simonas Mozūra  Leedust ning Vika Sobol ja Vladislav Kulygin Venemaalt. 

Black Nights Starsi rahvusvahelisse žüriisse kuuluvad Lina Todd, New Yorgis tegutsev casting director (Little Man Tate, A good Dat to Die Hard), Mike Rosser (Screen International), varasem European Shooting Star ja 2018. aastal Black Nights Starsi programmis osalenud Pääru Oja (O2, Viimased), Emmy'le nomineeriud casting director Nancy Bishop, (Casino Royale, Mr Bean's Holiday, The Liberator) ja Poola casting director Magdalena Szwarcbart (Schindler’s List, Cold War, Gareth Jones).  

Black Nights Stars programm toimub 23.-27.novembril 2020 ja on osa Pimedate Ööde Filmifestivali filmiprofessionaalide suunatud Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event programmist ning Euroopa Regionaalarengu Fondi rahastatud projektist Creative Gate.
contents_en:
[The Black Night Stars programme](https://industry.poff.ee/black-nights-stars/) is designed to build a bridge between foreign casting directors and new talent from the region – enhancing their international visibility. The aim is to help young actors from the Baltic Sea region promote themselves outside their home territory and acquire the practical skills needed for their future international careers. This year the program will focus on [how to navigate a career in an online world](https://industry.poff.ee/black-nights-stars-focuses-on-navigating-a-career-in-an-online-world/).

The international jury selected eight young actors from over 40 candidates, who are invited to attend the Black Nights Stars Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event, part of the 24th edition of the Tallinn Black Nights Film Festival (PÖFF). Previously there have been 6 emerging talents participating in the program each year, in 2020 also two young actors from Russia have been invited as Russia, as well as being part of Baltic Sea region, is this year’s focus country for Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event. 

A jury of international film professionals has selected the following actors: 

Aaron Hilmer (Germany), Antoni Sałaj (Poland), Hanna Ardéhn (Sweden), Henessi Schmidt (Estonia), Reimo Sagor (Estonia), Simonas Mozūra (Lithuania), Vika Sobol (Russia) and Vladislav Kulygin (Russia). 

The young actors have been chosen to present their emerging talent based on their first feature film and TV roles. Participating in Black Nights Stars will give the actors a chance to meet with film professionals and to showcase their talent. They will also participate in various masterclasses, workshops and industry networking events.

According to the **member of the international jury, Lina Todd** from Lina Todd casting agency, it was a tremendously gratifying experience to select talent from the Baltics. “Though all unique, they share an amazing presence, an unexpected force, mystery, soulful beauty, fierce intensity, intricate sensuality, and deepness which feels unique to their countries and still universal in their sincerity. It is of great value to the film industry to discover these marvellous and fresh artists who will shine, not just in their country, but internationally. To bring them to the film industry’s attention so they can further enrich our experience as audiences and bring us closer together is a treasure,” she added. 

The 2020 selection jury included **Lina Todd**, a casting director from New York (Little Man Tate, A Good Day to Die Hard, Crazy Alien); **Mike Rosser** (Screen International), former European Shooting Star and 2018 Black Nights Star **Pääru Oja** (O2, The Last Ones); US born casting director **Nancy Bishop**, based in Europe (The Liberator, the Romanoffs, Whiskey Cavalier) and **Magdalena Szwarcbart**, casting director from Poland (Schindler’s List, Cold War, Gareth Jones). 

The programme of Black Nights Stars 2020 will be carried out as an online event at Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event taking place during 23-27 November. The Black Nights Stars programme is presented by the [Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event](https://industry.poff.ee/) during the [Tallinn Black Nights Film Festival](https://industry.poff.ee/) and the European Regional Development Fund funded project Creative Gate.

title_et: Julien Temple saluteerib Kumu filmis Havannale
lead_et: Linnadele on pühendatud palju filme. „Habaneros”, mis linastub kolmapäeval Kumu kultuuriteemaliste dokumentaalfilmide programmis, on neist üks väljapaistvamaid.
contents_et:
Nimekas inglise filmitegija Julien Temple lööb kuumade kuuba rütmide saatel särama Havanna – haavatud, ent alistamatu linna, mis köidab oma ilu, ajaloo ja elanike lõputu energiaga.

Eepilise ulatusega filmis avavad Havanna elanikud oma kodulinna olemust – selle ilu ja valu. Vaataja juhitakse läbi Kuuba ajaloo – Hispaania vallutusest orjuse kaotamiseni ja revolutsioonist tänapäeva kommertsmaailma pealetungini. Kas Havanna suudab säilitada oma näo?

Julien Temple sai tuntuks Sex Pistolsi libadokumentaalfilmiga „The Great Rock´n´Roll Swindle”, ka tema edasise karjääri tippudeks on olnud muusikafilmid: „The Filth and the Fury”, „Glastonbury”, „The Future Is Unwritten: Joe Strummer». Ta on teinud ka muusikavideosid, näiteks The Rolling Stonesile, Iggy Popile ja David Bowiele.

Kumu auditooriumis 14. oktoobril kell 18  aset leidva seansi juhatab sisse raamatu „Minu Kuuba” autor Rain Urbsalu.

Film on inglise ja hispaania keeles ingliskeelsete subtiitritega. Sissepääs tasuta.

Kultuuriteemaliste filmide sarja „Kumu dokumentaal” korraldavad Kumu ja PÖFF.

title_et: Elisa
contents_et:
Elisal on suur au toetada Põhja-Euroopa ainsat A-kategooria filmifestivali, sest eesmärk on meil ühine – pakkuda unustamatuid elamusi igas vanuses publikule. 

Sel aastal on koostöös Elisaga võimalik nautida PÖFFi ka kodustes tingimustes. PÖFFi veebikinost leiad vaatamiseks 112 filmi. [Elisa Stage](https://poff.elisastage.ee/poff?lang=et) toob lisaks vaatajateni põneva festivalimelu, sh PÖFFi avatseremoonia ja auhinnatseremoonia, intervjuud ja vestluspaneelid. Traditsiooniliselt on Elisa klientidest filmigurmaanidele PÖFFi piletid ka soodsamad.

Kohtume PÖFFil!
contents_en:
Elisa is proud to be a supporter of the only category A film festival in Northern Europe because we share a common goal – to offer unforgettable experiences to audiences of all ages.

This year, with Elisa you can enjoy all 112 PÖFF movies at home via the PÖFF web cinema. In addition, with Elisa Stage you can enjoy anything and everything exciting at the PÖFF festival, from the opening and award ceremonies, to interviews and discussion panels. As is traditional, all Elisa customers can get PÖFF tickets at a discounted price.

See you at PÖFF!

title_en: PÖFF Shorts now an Academy Award Qualifying Festival
lead_en: The team of Black Nights celebrates the news its the sub-festival, international short film and animation festival PÖFF Shorts has now become an Academy Qualifying film event.
contents_en:
The team of Black Nights celebrates the news its the sub-festival, international short film and animation festival PÖFF Shorts has now become an Academy Qualifying film event.

The status means that, should they be eligible, films winning a qualifying award at PÖFF Shorts will be eligible to submit their films for consideration for both the Live Action and Animation Short Awards at the Academy Awards. Competition winners in both the International and National competitive sections of PÖFF Shorts will be eligible for possible qualification.

title_et: PÖFFi debüütfilmide konkursil osaleb ka Eesti film
title_en: PÖFF Announces First Feature Films, paving new ways in cinema.
lead_et: Viie aasta järel võistleb Pimedate Ööde filmifestivali debüütfilmide konkursil Eesti film – Lauri Randla „Hüvasti, NSVL”.
lead_ru: В конкурсную программу дебютов Таллиннского кинофестиваля «Тёмные ночи» (PÖFF) вошли 18 фильмов из разных уголков планеты, еще три киноработы покажут вне конкурса.
lead_en: Eighteen plus three budding filmmakers take the stage in this year's First Feature Selection, bringing freshness and quirky, new views.
contents_et:
Nostalgiline draamakomöödia ingerisoome perekonna värvikast elust ENSV lõpuaastatel perepoeg Johannese silme kaudu põhineb ingerisoomlasest autori lapsepõlveelamustel. Soomes, kellega koos see on toodetud, on seda nimetatud ka maailma esimeseks pikaks ingerisoome mängufilmiks. 

„Ma loodan, et mu film lükkab kas või natukenegi edasi selle keele väljasuremise,” on 39-aastane Randla ise öelnud. Filmi operaator on Elen Lotman, kunstnik Jaana Jüris ja peaprodutsent Peeter Urbla. Peaosas Niklas Kouzmitchev. 

Viimati osales Eesti linateos debüütfilmide võistluskavas 2015. aastal, kui linastus „Must alpinist”. 

![F_4_goodbye_soviet_union-2.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_4_goodbye_soviet_union_2_e5f0744cc6.jpg)
*Kaader filmist „Hüvasti, NSVL”*

Kokku on täna välja kuulutatud konkursiprogrammis 18 filmi, millest kümne puhul on tegu maailma-, seitsme puhul rahvusvahelise ja ühe puhul Euroopa esilinastusega. PÖFFi juht Tiina Lokk nimetas tänavust valikut jõuliseks, väljakutsuvaks ja mitmekesiseks, mis esindab filmikunstis kõike värsket ja vitaalset. „Kui filmitööstus ühel heal päeval taastub, viivad just sellised autorid seda edasi,” ütles ta. 

Žanriliselt leiab klassikaliste draamafilmide kõrvalt enim draamakomöödiaid. Sonia Liza Kentermani „Rätsep” viib näiteks majanduskriisist räsitud Kreekasse, kus ühelt sugupõlvelt teisele pärandatav rätsepatöökoda satub kokkuvarisemise äärele ja selle pärijal tuleb leiutada midagi täiesti uut, et ellu jääda. Belglaste Ann Sirot´ ning Raphaël Balboni filmis „Meeletult elus” tekitab aga dementsuse tõttu lapsikuks muutunud vanaproua tõelise kaose, keerates poja ja minia elu pea peale. 

![F_1_tailor.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_1_tailor_7a6a4d034e.jpg)
*Kaader filmist „Rätsep”*

On ajaloolisi ja põnevusdraamasid, ka üks fantaasiadraama, itaallase Nicolangelo Gelormini „Fortuna – tüdruk ja hiiglased”, milles väike tüdruk usub, et on inimeste keskele sattunud tulnukaprintsess. Austraalia režissööri Victoria Wharfe McIntyre´i „Üleujutus” esindab vesternit – see on kättemaksufilm, mis teeb kummarduse aborigeenide kultuurilisele pärandile. 

Otse tõsielust on pärit poolaka Jan Holoubeki film „25 aastat süütuna”, mis põhineb kogu Poolat vapustanud lool, kus noor mees – Tomasz Komenda – mõisteti teismelise tüdruku vägistamise eest 25 aastaks vangi. Ta istus trellide taga 18 aastat, enne kui süütuks tunnistati. 

![F_1_25_years_of_innocence-2.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_1_25_years_of_innocence_2_270e00c4dc.jpg)
*Kaader filmist „25 aastat süütuna”*

Maailmajagudest on tänavuses võistluskavas Euroopa, Aasia, Ameerika ja Austraalia filme: 11 Euroopast, neli Aasiast, kaks Ameerikast ja üks Austraaliast. Esimest korda võib võistluskavast leida Süüria filmi. 

Kõige noorem režissöör on 26-aastane venelane Dmitri Rudakov, kelle film „Sentents” on pühendatud kirjanik Varlam Šalamovi viimastele elupäevadele. Vanim on 49-aastane süürlanna Rana Kazkaz – tema ja kaasrežissöör Anas Khalafi põnevusdraama „Tõlkija” räägib süüria poliitilisest pagulasest, kes naaseb pärast revolutsiooni puhkemist kodumaale, kui ta saab teada, et tema vend on arreteeritud.

Oma kodumaal on juba pälvinud tunnustust Lõuna-Korea režissööri Bae Jong-dae psühholoogiline draama „Must valgus”, mille peaosatäitja Yeom Hye-ran võitis Jeonju festivalil korea filmide võistlusprogrammis parima naisnäitleja preemia. 

![F_10_Black_Light.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_10_Black_Light_6f09e0f8c1.jpg)
*Kaader filmist „Must valgus”*

Väljaspool võistlust jõuavad ekraanile Joe Marcantonio psühholoogiline põnevusfilm „Sugulased”, Nacho Álvarezi muusikalifilm „Süda tuksub tuks-tuks-tuks” ja Evi Romeni draamafilm „Miks mitte sina”. Viimane võitis äsja Zürichi filmifestivalil võistlusprogrammi Fookus, kus linastatakse Saksamaa, Austria ja Šveitsi lavastajate huvitavamaid uusi töid. 

Pimedate Ööde filmifestival leiab aset 13. novembrist 29. novembrini kombineeritud kujul – filme saab esimest korda vaadata nii kinodes kui virtuaalselt.
 
![F_2_my_heart_goes_boom.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_2_my_heart_goes_boom_13b67da4ef.jpg)
*Kaader filmist „Süda tuksub tuks-tuks-tuks”*

Alates tänasest saavad debüütfilmide võistluse pileteid osta PÖFFi lojaalsusprogrammiga liitunud inimesed ehk Hundikarja liikmed, reedest ka kõik teised soovijad. Kuni 8. novembrini on piletid müügil 5-eurose soodushinnaga. 

PÖFFi virtuaalsete seansside pileteid saab osta alates 6. novembrist. Virtuaalne PÖFF jõuab publikuni veebiplatvormide Shift72 ja Elisa Stage vahendusel. 

Festival rakendab kõiki koos Terviseametiga välja töötatud ohutusreegleid, et tagada kinokülastajatele turvaline keskkond. Maskid on rangelt soovituslikud, festival varustab nendega kõiki külastajaid tasuta. Seansside vaheajal kinosaale puhastatakse ja desinfitseeritakse. 

[PÖFFi külastamine koroona tingimustes](https://poff.ee/artikkel/turvajuhised-ja-nouanded/)

PÖFFi esitlevad Elisa ja Nordic Hotel Forum.
contents_en:
In a challenging time for many emerging and established artists, PÖFF is happy to announce a selection of 18 films in the First Feature Competition and an additional 3 out of competition. First Feature Films distinguish themselves by their freshness, vitality, and revelatory nature. These are the films and filmmakers to pave new pathways in the landscape of cinema in the years to come. Or as festival director Tiina Lokk has said; once the film industry gets on its feet again, these are the filmmakers who will carry on the torch. 

Among the First Feature Films are Cannes Official Selection 2020 Should the Wind Drop by French-Armenian video-artist-turned-feature-director Nora Martirosyan, a Colombian female-focused coming-of-age film, which has a part-pro, part-untrained cast, a Danish black comedy, a 16mm black-and-white gaze into a Russian poet’s soul, and a quirky local masterpiece on the collapse of the Soviet Union. Ten of the films are World Premieres. 

The festival is moving forward with preparations for a physical event and will make everything in its power to bring the filmmakers to Tallinn to attend their screenings. As Estonia's travel restrictions are decided every month, it will become clear at the end of October who can travel to Tallinn. The virtual screenings of the films will include pre-recorded Q&A's with the filmmakers. 



# **First Feature Competition**

![Translator.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/Translator_bfd1212dd9.jpg)
**The Translator**

Screening as a world-premiere, from Syrian co-directors Rana Kazkaz & Anas Khalaf, the story is told with inventive cinematography and a constant low-level tension. Spinning from the normalcy of an optician’s office to the absurdity of background low-level conflict, a relentless narrative drive pushes the audience looping toward the film’s fundamental question: will the translator finally find his own voice? 

![F_1_poppy_field.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_1_poppy_field_7f4b689391.jpg)
**Poppy Field**

Shot on 16mm film, in the tangle of brutalist Bucharest, Eugen Jebeleanu’s debut feature explores protest, religion, identity and more, as a gay street cop struggles to balance his prosaic professional duties and personal politics. As the film juggles languages and viewpoints, our protagonist states, “It’s complicated” and it’s true. We’re delighted to welcome Poppy Field for its world premiere. 

![F_1_longing_souls.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_1_longing_souls_37e7c50f99.jpg)
**Longing Souls** 

Colombian Diana Montenegro follows up a series of female-focused shorts with this coming-of-age drama, constructed on the shoulders of a part-pro, part-untrained cast. A child is initiated into a circle of fatalistic, self-identifying “cursed” ladies. Longing Souls lets us look again at the world of women through untarnished glass and appears at PÖFF as a world premiere. 

![F_3_AS_FAR_AS_I_KNOW.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_3_AS_FAR_AS_I_KNOW_57d9510c49.jpg)
**As Far as I Know** 

Hungarian directors Nándor Lörincz and Bálint Nagy have created a real brain-worm: a morally complex narrative to think and rethink, lingering long in the audience’s minds. The story follows two soon-to-be-parents, in a fractious relationship, as they struggle with slippery truths and their life-changing consequences. This Budapest-set drama screens as a world premiere. 

![F_5_model_olimpia.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_5_model_olimpia_cc87c99881.jpg)
**Modell Olimpia** 

From this year’s festival focus country, director Frédéric Hambalek paints DIY therapy, existential dread and psychological terror across a canvas of German domesticity. The introduction of a new neighbour to the treatment programme makes the system spiral out of control. Up to its final frames, it skillfully skirts the boundaries of fantasy and reality. This deeply unsettling feature also has its world premiere at PÖFF. 

![F_5_great_happiness.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_5_great_happiness_2a700262da.jpg)
**Great Happiness**

Set in modern China, Wang Yiao’s youthful ensemble piece follows the fortunes of three friends as they seek their future in a world changing almost faster than they can recognise. With a backdrop ranging from endless forests of skyscrapers to technicolour mahjong tables, a maze of plotlines tie together friendship, family and, of course, business. Great Happiness appears as a world premiere at Black Nights. 

![F_1_sententia.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_1_sententia_b74601f1e3.jpg)
**Sententia**

Shot on black and white 16mm film, Dmitry Rudakov’s debut is a beautiful, meditative dramatisation of the end of Russian poet and Gulag survivor Varlam Shalamov’s life. Two of his most fervent followers attempt to piece together and decipher his final works, as he maintains his creative output up to his last breath. The film also has its world premiere at PÖFF this year. 

![F_1_karnawal.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_1_karnawal_18e756c6ae.jpg)
**Karnawal**

A co-production between Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Mexico, Bolivia and Norway, Karnawal, having its world premiere in Tallinn, brings to light the Malambo dance culture. We see a young boy’s training (for the competition of his life) interrupted by the reappearance of his absentee father. Juan Pablo Félix’s direction is exuberant, but with the vibrancy undercut with darkness.   

![F_9_the_penultimate.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_1_the_penultimate_f879d4ed72.jpg)
**The Penultimate**

All our unsuspecting lead character wants to do is check the water meter, but writer-director Kærup Hjort takes him into a deep and twisting, absurdist black comedy, shot through claustrophobic narrow framing, in a cavernous, labyrinthine bunker. A graduate of the Danish National Film School, Hjort’s background in theatre comes shining through in this PÖFF world premiere. 

![F_1_tailor.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_1_tailor_6de9d4b226.jpg)
**Tailor**

A charming, beautiful and understated piece from Greek-German director Sonia Liza Kenterman. Like it’s lead character, it’s a quietly propulsive tale that doesn’t necessarily reveal all its secrets: a perfect fit for these times of change, challenge and reinvention. We also see PÖFF as a perfect fit for its World premiere. 

![F_1_goodbye_soviet_union 2.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_1_goodbye_soviet_union_2_d941bb5c1a.jpg)
**Goodbye, Soviet Union**

Ingrian-Finnish, Estonian-born director Lauri Randla piles culture-clash upon culture-clash in this recent-period piece. Though on the surface quirky, accessible and blackly comic, it’s a transportive journey and a unique, surprising perspective on the ramshackle collapse of communism and the making of a nation and a man. We’re very proud to host this international premiere in Estonia. 

![F_1_the_enemies.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_1_the_enemies_fb65249b44.jpg)
**The Enemies**

An intricate and ingenious, fantastical slice of life drama taking in hairdressing, nasty letters from your neighbours and lots of cats. Even while holding up a mirror to a complex, restrictive and sometimes hypocritical society, Ali Derakhshandeh’s film still has a definite sparkle in its cinematic eye and appears as an international premiere at PÖFF. 

![F_1_25_years_of_innocence.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_1_25_years_of_innocence_bbb4ee2ad5.jpg)
**25 Years of Innocence**

Also having its international premiere at PÖFF, this torn-from-the-headlines story digs deep into one man’s extreme misfortune: the setup, the tragedy and glimpses of the lasting repercussions. After living much of your life accused of an unspeakable crime, how can you live with yourself? Coming from a background in TV, it’s an assured feature debut from Poland’s Jan Holoubek, artfully bouncing between the personal, political and institutional. 

![F_4_madly_in_life.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_4_madly_in_life_fbe44b9d9d.jpg)
**Madly in Life**

Thirty-something couple Alex and Noémie find their child-rearing plans upended when Alex’s elderly mother begins exhibiting signs of dementia. It’s a heavy subject, but hilarious storytelling in this role-reversal dramedy. Belgian director duo Ann Sirot and Raphaël Balboni will have the international premiere of Madly in Life at PÖFF. 

![F_10_Black_Light.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_10_Black_Light_6f09e0f8c1.jpg)
**Black Light**

Bae Jong-dae’s clear-eyed drama sees two women struggle through the stages of grief in the aftermath of a fatal car accident. Along the way, they fight the police, their families and each other to get to a truth that doesn’t really suit anyone involved. Black Nights is proud to host this moving, honest and naturalistic picture for its international premiere. 

![F_7_the_flood.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_7_the_flood_095d3db68c.jpg)
**The Flood**

A film that’s sometimes wrapped in the dream-like spiritual embrace of pure Australian nature, sometimes exploding into percussive action and flashes of ultra-violence. This revenge thriller is a maximalist visual and auditory feast, certainly not for the faint of heart. We are very excited to also host Victoria Wharfe McIntyre’s film for its international premiere. 

![F_1_fortuna_the_girl_and_the_giants.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_1_fortuna_the_girl_and_the_giants_84968da3be.jpg)
**Fortuna – The Girl and the Giants**

Nicolangelo Gelormini’s suburban fantasy creates a unique, eye-popping and immersive visual world. A six-year-old with magnificent hair and a loose relationship with reality may be an ordinary small Italian child or may be an alien called Nancy. This beguiling dark fairytale, a giallo-with-kids, has its international premiere at PÖFF. 

![F_1_should_the_wind_drop.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_1_should_the_wind_drop_79a3119162.jpg)
**Should the Wind Drop**

French-Armenian video-artist-turned-feature-director Nora Martirosyan charts the unexpected complexities involved in approving the opening of an international airport in a freshly-independent imaginary micro-state. From this peripheral perspective, we follow a universal, life-affirming and frankly absurd story that’s been an official selection at Cannes this year before its European premiere here at PÖFF.  







# First Feature out of competition 

![F_3_why_not_you.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_3_why_not_you_7232431f92.jpg)
**Why Not You**

Co-premiering together with Zurich International Film Festival and winning the Golden Eye award there this October, Evi Romen’s moody drama is a study in grief, loss and the places they can take you. Already an award-winning editor, Romen’s twisty piece deals head on with LGBT+ issues and religion, alongside plenty of dancing.  

![F_2_my_heart_goes_boom.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_2_my_heart_goes_boom_13b67da4ef.jpg)
**My Heart Goes Boom!**

Uruguayan Nacho Álvarez makes his debut with this exuberant Spanish/Italian co-production. The very definition of all-singing-and-all-dancing, it’s the story of a woman born to perform and her highly personal experience of censorship in 70s Spain. It comes to us for its international premiere after screening at San Sebastian. 

![F_4_kindred.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/F_4_kindred_1e66977af3.jpg)
**Kindred**
Showing out of competition but as a European premiere, American-in-Britain Joe Marcantonio’s debut is a compact and claustrophobic psychological in-law horror piece. It swirls around most varieties of social conflict, inside the creatively lensed dilapidated Scottish country manor owned by Fiona Shaw’s family matriarch.
contents_ru:
Список из 12 мировых, пяти международных и одной европейской премьеры олицетворяет собой миссию фестиваля, которая заключается в открытии новых творческих голосов со всего мира, предоставлении им стартовой площадки и продвижении их к международному признанию. Вне конкурса на экране появятся три дебютные работы: одна из Австралии, вторая испано-итальянского производства и третья из Великобритании. Фильм «Почему не ты» покажут совместно с Международным кинофестивалем в Цюрихе, и «Когда ветер стихнет» входит в главную конкурсную программу Каннского кинофестиваля.

Состав международного жюри, состоящего из профессионалов киноиндустрии, будет объявлен во второй половине октября. Лучший фильм получит награду и премию в размере 5000 евро, а также будут присуждены еще два специальных приза.

Директор фестиваля и программный директор Тийна Локк прокомментировала: «Довольно часто звучит то, что для киноиндустрии сейчас непростое время.  Поэтому обнадеживает тот факт, что в этом году мы все же можем представить такую программу дебютных фильмов и показать фильмы как в кинотеатрах Эстонии, так и онлайн. Это подборка сильных, разнообразных и заставляющих подумать фильмов, которые несут в себе саму жизнь, свежесть и откровения. Когда индустрия выздоровеет (а это обязательно произойдет), именно такие кинематографисты будут идти впереди». 

Среди прочих в программе будет представлен дебютный полнометражный фильм Дмитрия Рудакова на русском языке «Сентенция», рассказывающий историю прошедшего ГУЛАГ писателя Варлама Шаламова. В программу вошла и кинокартина эстонского режиссера Лаури Рандла «Прощай, Советский Союз!», посвященный последним годам советской эпохи в Эстонии. 

С сегодняшнего дня началась продажа билетов для людей, присоединившихся к программе лояльности PÖFF, и с завтрашнего дня билеты смогут купить все желающие. До 8 ноября билеты можно приобрести по выгодной цене 5 евро. 

Фестиваль соблюдает все правила безопасности, разработанные совместно с Департаментом здоровья, чтобы обеспечить безопасную среду для посетителей кинотеатров. Настоятельно рекомендуется носить защитные маски, которые фестиваль будет бесплатно выдавать всем посетителям. Между сеансами кинозалы будут мыть и обрабатывать антисептиками.

Билеты на онлайн-сеансы PÖFF поступят в продажу 6 ноября. Виртуальный PÖFF пройдет на платформах Shift72 и Elisa Stage.

24-й кинофестиваль «Темные ночи» пройдет с 13 по 29 ноября в комбинированном формате – фильмы можно будет посмотреть как на большом экране в кинотеатрах, так и онлайн.

PÖFF представляют Elisa и Nordic Hotel Forum.
  
#blacknightsfilmfestival #PÖFF24
 

# ФИЛЬМЫ КОНКУРСНОЙ ПРОГРАММЫ ДЕБЮТОВ

 
**Сентенция (Sententia)**

2020, Россия, режиссер: Дмитрий Рудаков | Мировая премьера

Прошедший ГУЛАГ писатель Варлам Шаламов, автор «Колымских рассказов», тихо угасает в доме престарелых, но до последнего продолжает творить. Двое его самых пылких последователей пытаются собрать его творчество воедино и расшифровать каждое слово.

<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/jUGAyaQ3Ky4" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>


**Маковое поле (Câmp de maci)**
2020, Румыния, режиссер: Еуджен Жебеляну | Мировая премьера

Скрывающий свою сексуальную ориентацию полицейский-гей должен вмешаться в акцию протеста, организованную гомофобами после киносеанса на тему ЛГБТ. Очень психологически напряженный фильм.

<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/vS_-hBUpUVg" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>
 

**Душа хочет летать (El Alma Quiere Volar)**
2020, Колумбия/Бразилия, режиссер: Диана Монтенегро | Мировая премьера

10-летняя Камила обнаруживает, что женщины из ее рода считают себя проклятыми и объясняют этим беды, настигающие их в жизни. Как же жить дальше? Матриархальная сага, деликатная и интимная история о женственности и комплексах.

<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/q8blob-lBGs" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>
 

**Насколько мне известно (Legjobb Tudomásom Szerint)**
2020, Румыния/Венгрия, режиссеры: Нандор Лёринц, Балинт Надь | Мировая премьера

Венгерские режиссеры Нандор Лёринц и Бюлинт Надь создали морально сложное повествование, которое заставляет думать и переосмысливать, надолго задерживаясь в умах зрителей. История Норы и Денеса, которые решаются на усыновление ребенка. В одно утро Нора возвращается домой и сообщает, что ее изнасиловали. Денесу же начинает казаться, что это ничто иное, как способ привлечь внимание. Фильм основан на реальных событиях.
 

**Модель Олимпа (Modell Olimpia)**
2020, Германия, режиссер: Фредерик Хамбалек | Мировая премьера

Сумасшедшая мать придумывает странный план помощи своему сыну с деструктивными мыслями. Абсурдная драма, которая исследует все самые темные уголки души молодого человека и воспитательные меры мамы-наседки.

<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/fzgDFujH1-o" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

 
**Портной (Raftis/Ράφτης)**
2020, Греция/Германия/Бельгия, режиссер: Соня Лиза Кентерман | Мировая премьера

Красивая работа греко-немецкого режиссера Сони Лизы Кентерман. Очень личная и трогательная трагикомедия о тревожных и грустных моментах в истории Греции.

<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/-FFQJzDmSDU" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>
 

**Большое счастье (Great Happiness)**
2020, Китай, режиссер: Ван Цзяо | Мировая премьера
